change.changenote: Regulation BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 226/2009, effective September 28, 2009.

definition.def: means an investment share as defined in the Cooperative Association Act;
means a membership share as defined in the Cooperative Association Act;
means a patronage return as defined in the Cooperative Association Act.

subsection.subsectiontext: For the purposes of this rule, membership or investment shares acquired as, or by the application of, a dividend, interest, or a patronage return are considered to have no acquisition cost.

section.marginalnote: Conditions prescribed under section 46 (h) of the Securities Act
section.sectiontext: The following conditions are prescribed under section 46 (h) of the Securities Act:

paragraph.paragraphtext: an association may rely on section 46 (h) of the Securities Act for a trade in membership shares of its own issue if,

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: before the trade, the association receives from the purchaser a statement in writing declaring the aggregate acquisition cost of all membership and investment shares of that association currently held by the purchaser,
at the time of the trade, the association has no reasonable grounds to believe that the amount declared under subparagraph (i) is not accurate, and
the acquisition cost to the purchaser of the membership shares, together with the amount declared under subparagraph (i), does not exceed $5 000;

paragraph.paragraphtext: an association may rely on section 46 (h) of the Securities Act for a trade in investment shares of its own issue if,

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: before the trade, the association receives from the purchaser a statement in writing declaring the aggregate acquisition cost of all membership and investment shares of that association currently held by the purchaser,
at the time of the trade, the association has no reasonable grounds to believe that the amount declared under subparagraph (i) is not accurate,
the acquisition cost to the purchaser of the investment shares, together with the amount declared under subparagraph (i), does not exceed $5 000,

the number of members of the association whose last address as shown on the books of the association is in British Columbia does not exceed 150, not including members that are employed by the association in a full time capacity, and
the purchaser is a member and has been a member of the association

clause.clausetext: since the inception of the association, if the association has been in existence for less than 12 months;

paragraph.paragraphtext: an association may rely on section 46 (h) of the Securities Act for a trade in a security of its own issue if

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the security is distributed by it as, or by the application of, a dividend, interest or a patronage return, and
no commission or other remuneration is paid or given to others in respect of the trade except for administrative or professional services or for services performed by a registered dealer;

paragraph.paragraphtext: a member of an association may rely on section 46 (h) of the Securities Act for a trade in a security of the association if the purchaser of the security is a member and has been a member of that association

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: since the inception of the association, if the association has been in existence for less than 12 months.
